section.title: Creating custom page types
section.para: When extending Zym_Navigation_Page, the child class cannot override the constructor. This is used to force every page class to accept only an array or a Zend_Config object as the only argument to the constructor, so that all page types can created using the page factory method.

example.title: The most simple custom page
example.para: The only thing you need to add to a custom page is the getHref() method.

section.para: There is no need to override the setOptions() and setConfig() when extending the abstract page class, even if the new child class have properties that are not in the abstract class. setOptions() will translate the given option name to a potential method name and use method_exists() to determine if there is matching set method for the option.

example.title: Adding properties
example.para: When adding properties to an extended page, there is no need to override/modify setOptions() or setConfig().

section.para: By default, Zym_Navigation_Page will validate that a label is set when the page is being constructed. If you want to add extra validation to be done when constructing, to ensure that a page cannot be in an invalid state, you should overload the _validate() method and add whatever validation you need there.
